name: TheAtlantic
text: For the first time ever, a woman, Maya Gabeira, surfed a taller wave than her male counterpart, breaking a world record in the process. So why do some people think the World Surf League is burying that news? @maggiejmertens reports: https://t.co/kpUGYfLboD

name: TheAtlantic
text: One progressive group's strategy to help Biden appeal to young voters: promote him as part of a group of "Democratic Avengers," @olgakhazan reports: https://t.co/4RyPchViXp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Readers respond to our July/August 2020 cover story and more: https://t.co/IMyGI0hX1O

name: TheAtlantic
text: Revisit a poem from yesteryear, read a short story, tour America from your couch, and other suggestions for the weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/cIrVjg3K5F

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: "An Instagram post tagged #nofilter makes an implicit claim against artifice: This is how it really looked. And yet, there is no such thing as an unfiltered image, just differently filtered ones." This by @ibogost is so interesting https://t.co/s5JrX5vPGb

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @krisguillaume: Prison literature explores how to build a more just society, what purpose the police serve, and whether prisons should exist. Books by Malcolm X, Austin Reed, Susan Burton, and more in my briefing for @TheAtlantic https://t.co/1TrgVXgzgz
